description: Detects rhetoric and systemic framing that convert structural advantage into claims of personal superiority. Identifies when merit, intelligence, or effort are invoked to justify inequity or diminish others' experiences.

linguistic: comparative devaluation phrases ('not as smart', 'didn't work hard enough')
dismissal of contextual barriers ('everyone has the same chances')
overgeneralization from personal success ('if I did it, anyone can')
structural: legacy advantage markers (wealth, education lineage, network inheritance)
policy language equating outcome with virtue

fusion_logic.method: contrastive correlation analysis between claimed merit and contextual variables

thresholds.high (>0.6): merit distortion ‚Äì systemic advantage masked as personal virtue

recommended_reframing: surface contextual supports ('what structures enabled this success?')
convert comparison into collaboration framing ('how can others be supported to succeed too?')
